question:
Consider the following statements about the National Ayurveda Day:
  1. It was celebrated on 28th October for the year 2016
  2. It is celebrated on the birth anniversary of Sushruta, an ancient Indian physician
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: First statement is correct. Second statement is incorrect because it is celebrated on the occasion of Dhanwantari Jayanti. Recently, the first National Ayurveda Day was observed on 28 October 2016 by the Ministry of Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homoeopathy (AYUSH), on the occasion of Dhanwantari Jayanti. Dhanwantari is an avatar of Vishnu in Hinduism. He appears in the Vedas and Puranas as the physician of the gods (Devas), and the god of Ayurveda. Dhanwantari Jayanti, the birthday of lord Dhanwantari is being celebrated on 13th lunar day of darker side in the Hindu month of Kartik (Oct/Nov).
